notes_display: Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap; terminating in an eagle's wing at the back; covered korymbos; plain diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; tunica, neck-line edged with double row of pearl; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. 'yry mzdysn bgy wrhr'n MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Wahrām šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Wahram, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seed (image|splendour) is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with parallel strokes; to the left of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Wahram II, holding lance in right hand, left hand resting on scabbard, to the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ahuramazda, holding lance in left hand, right hand resting on scabbard, both facing outwards, dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l. i. NWRA [ZY], 9 h l. o. wrhr'n| ādur ī wrhr'n|“the fire of Wahram”
